Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a personal anecdote without providing any additional evidence or data to support the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the fee for hazardous materials was unnecessary or unjustified without considering the legal requirements and regulations in place at the time.
Understate: The claim may understate the importance or significance of the fee by referring to it as a "hundred-something dollar fee" without providing the exact amount.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the fee was a requirement under the Hazardous Substances Right to Know Act and was applicable to all Rhode Island employers at the time.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the fee, such as the need for funding to enforce and regulate the hazardous substances law.
